snippet: The suit, objecting to wording describing the New York State ballot question in positive terms, was “untimely and lacking in legal merit,” the judge said.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Richard M Platkin dismisses lawsuit that sought to stop November casino gambling referendum; says legal challenge over measure's wording was 'untimely and lacking in legal merit'; ballot question would amend New York State Constitution to allow up to seven casinos.
lead_paragraph: The suit, objecting to wording describing the New York State ballot question in positive terms, was “untimely and lacking in legal merit,” the judge said.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Suit to Block Vote on Casinos
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Suit to Block Vote on Casinos
